summary: Aircraft construction inspections check airplane sanitation systems. Specifically, they help ensure that the aircraft galley and lavatories are easy to clean, that no insects or pests are present, and that the drinking water system is installed correctly. The U.S. Food and Drug Administration does these free inspections at the request of aircraft manufacturers and U.S.-based commercial airlines. title: Aviation Sanitation: FDA Could Better Communicate with Airlines to Encourage Voluntary Construction Inspections of Aircraft Galleys and Lavatories
